1.subquestion: Find the number of indoor plants first using one fourth from the total plant count.

subanswer.text: We calculate one-fourth of the plants: (1/4) * 9955955 = 2488988.75 or approximately 2488989 when rounded off since you cannot have fractional parts of physical objects like plants. The answer is roughly estimated at 2488989.

2.subquestion: Now find what remains once these indoor plants are removed. This will give us all other types minus indoor ones. Let’s call this result X_minus_indoor.

subanswer.text: To get X_minus_indoor, subtract the approximate number of indoor plants from the total: X_minus_indoor = 9955955 - 2488989 ≈ 7466966. Thus, almost 7466966 plants remain categorized under non-indoor groups. The answer is nearly 7466966.

direct_answer.text:
Step 1: Find the number of non-indoor plants  
Number_of_non_indoor_plants=total_number_of_plants−individual_count_of_indoor_plant   
                                =9955955 − 2488988       
                                =7466967      
             
 Step 2 : Calculate percentage share/fractional shares    
Share_for_outdoor_plants=(two third)/(all)=2/3          =>Fractional Share Outdoors     
Remaining_share_to_be_divided=total_remainder—share_outdoors              
Total Remainding Plants Fraction=Indoors+(Outdoors+Flowers)/Indoors            
=> Indoors/(Indoors+(Outdoors+Flowers))           
To find Flowers fraction          
Percentage_flower_Plant=(the one leftover when divided evenly among three parts × 100%)        
                               ≈(([1]÷[(1)+([2])])×100%)

0.user_question: There are 9955955 plants in Mrs. Smith's garden. One-fourth of her plants are indoor plants. Two-thirds of the remaining are outdoor plants while the rest are flowering plants. What percent of the plants are flowering plants?

direct_answer.text: Firstly let's find one-fourth of all the plants which would represent the Indoor Plants count; (1/4) x 9955955= 2488988.75 approximately equals about  2,488,989 as we can not have partial plants so rounding off it becomes rounded figure i.e., whole Number Hence Remaining Plant Count Would Be As follows => Total Plants – Indoor Plants = Outside Plus Flowers Plants → 9955955–2488989=7466966 Therefore We Need To Find Out Percentage Of these flowers And this percentage Will Also Equals Percentages Off All Other Types Of Plants Like Bamboo or Tulips etc.. But here It Is Important That They Should Not Add Up TO Make UP ALL TOTAL OF PLANTS Or ELSE Our Calculation WOULD BE INCORRECT! This Problem Can Only Be Solved When You Know Both These Values Exactly OR THE SUM MUST REMAIN AS WHAT IT IS AT BEGINNING!!! Here Sum Was Original Value At Start Which Means Whole

0.user_question: There are 9955955 plants in Mrs. Smith's garden. One-fourth of her plants are indoor plants. Two-thirds of the remaining are outdoor plants while the rest are flowering plants. What percent of the plants are flowering plants?

1.subquestion: Let us first find one fourth of all the plants (Indoor). Since they constitute fractional part(one quarter) then multiply number of plant from whole no., i.e.: Number_of_Plants × Fraction_to_get Indoor=Number_of_Indoor_plants; thus, Number_of_Indoor_plantis=9955955×¼=2488988.75≈2488989. The answer is approximately 2488989 because you cannot count fractions of something like flowers or

subanswer.text: Consider rounding up since partial plants don't exist physically. Thus, Approximately 2488990 indoor plants. To get the number of non-indoor plants use the equation Total_non_indoor_plants=(Total_number_of_all_plants)-No_of_indoor_plants. Substituting values here would give Non_indoor_plants=9955955-(approximately)=9931065 . Outdoor_flower_plants=(Fraction_outside*Non_indoor_total)+(Fraction_flowers*(Remaining)) ; Remaining=[All Plants]−[Outdoors]+[Flowers]; Rearranging terms ,we will finally reach [Flowers]=((1 − ¾)-(⅓)))⋅Total_no_of_plants=. Flower_plants=(⅛)*9955955.=~1244494.4 approx ~1244494. Hence answering Question five : Flowering plants make about ~1244494 %.(Since percents normally refer to ratios between things not totals.)

2.subquestion: Now we can answer the question: Percentage of flower plants ?

subanswer.text: From above calculation percentage of flowering plants equals:(Flowers)/(Total No. Of Plant)*100%, substituting our value hence,(Percentage of flowers)=(1244494/(9955955))∗100%=approx.  12%. Answer is roughly 12% depending upon whether rounded numbers had been used during calculations or exact decimal representation maintained till end etc..

direct_answer.text: To find the exact percentage of flowering plants without rounding up, let's solve it numerically first. Let P represent all the plants initially present in the garden, so \(P=9955955\). We know one fourth are indoor plants (\(\frac{1}{4}P\)), leaving three quarters not indoors \(\left(1-\frac{1}{4}\right)P=\frac{3}{4}P\). Out of these non-indoor ones, two thirds are outdoor plants, meaning only one third would contribute toward our count of flowering plants. Thus, those counted here include both flowers among other things like foliage since no specific distinction was provided about types amongst 'remaining'.
